title: Midland Bank donates ambulance to Anjuman
body: Midland Bank PLC has donated an ambulance to Anjuman Mofidul Islam, a charitable organisation and one of the leading ambulance service providers in Dhaka city, serving both patients and deceased persons within and outside Dhaka, says a press release. This donation is part of the bankâ€™s commitment to social wellbeing under its CSR programme. The Bank has provided this ambulance from the Islami Banking Compensation Fund. Md Ahsan-uz Zaman, managing director and CEO of the bank; handed over the key of the ambulance to Mohammad Azim Bakhsh and Alhaj Mohammad Aslam, trustees, vice-presidents of Anjuman Mofidul Islam. The programme was held on December 4 at the Head Office of the bank. Anjuman Mofidul Islam provides free ambulance services in Dhaka city. The well-known organisation also undertakes various other charitable activities for the welfare of society. Among others, Syed Lukman Ahmed, joint director, branch, of Anjuman Mofidul Islam; Md Rashed Akter, head of retail distribution and chief bancassurance officer; Didarul Islam, CFO; Md Bajlur Rahman Khan, head of CRM and head of sustainable finance unit; and Nakul Chandra Debnath, head of GSD of Midland Bank, were also present at the handover ceremony.
